issue.title: Google Analytics CSP Error https://region1.analytics.google.com

labels.name: Reported on 2.4.6-p1
labels.description: Indicates original Magento version for the Issue report.

issue.body:
### Preconditions and environment

- Magento version
2.4.6-p1


### Steps to reproduce

Enable Google Analytics
View Website from the EU - Inspect and view CSP console errors.


### Expected result

No CSP errors

### Actual result

[Report Only] Refused to connect to 'https://region1.analytics.google.com/g/collect?v=28****** REMOVED ********' because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "connect-src www.google-analytics.com www.googleadservices.com analytics.google.com www.googletagmanager.com vimeo.com www.sandbox.paypal.com www.paypalobjects.com www.paypal.com pilot-payflowlink.paypal.com *.ideal-postcodes.co.uk *.doubleclick.net *.google-analytics.com 'self' 'unsafe-inline'".

### Additional information

See update from Google:
https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/12017362?sjid=7210281846540305633-EU

> EU data is collected in the EU
> Google Analytics 4 collects all data from EU-based devices (based on IP-geo lookup) through domains and on servers based in the EU before [forwarding traffic to Analytics servers for processing](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/11598602).
> 
> If you currently use a [Content Security Policy (CSP)](https://developers.google.com/tag-platform/tag-manager/web/csp), update your configurations (img-src and connection-src directives) to allow the following domains used by Analytics:
> 
> *.google-analytics.com
> *.analytics.google.com

### Release note

_No response_

### Triage and priority

- [ ] Severity: **S0** _- Affects critical data or functionality and leaves users without workaround._
- [ ] Severity: **S1** _- Affects critical data or functionality and forces users to employ a workaround._
- [ ] Severity: **S2** _- Affects non-critical data or functionality and forces users to employ a workaround._
- [X] Severity: **S3** _- Affects non-critical data or functionality and does not force users to employ a workaround._
- [ ] Severity: **S4** _- Affects aesthetics, professional look and feel, “quality” or “usability”._

comment.body: Hi @timpea-splat . Thanks for reporting and collaboration. Tested google analytics CSP errors for EU region and the able to reproduce the issue. Please refer the screenshot below.

pull_request.title: Fix grunt compiled less sourcemaps
pull_request.body: ### Description (*) I don't even believe that no one didn't comment this PR https://github.com/magento/magento2/pull/31618 during 2 years. Do you know that styles sourcemaps are broken since updating this package in `package.json`. each time it has to be fixed for a new project. grunt-contrib-less `1.4.1`: grunt-contrib-less `~2.1.0`: you ask for self-checking, tests running, screenshots, but don't check the first development steps when you update something. that's weird. video example that includes the fix (use subtitles) with timecode: https://youtu.be/NEKvPRTW9mM?si=2f_ZXV-WNR8IyN9N&t=699 that's even funny that in M2.4.7 beta this package is updated to `~3.0.0` https://github.com/magento/magento2/commit/203f415cd5f314401a335991bd97919e3baa9dc3 but it couldn't be compiled because of error: ``` Running "less:demo" (less) task >> pub/static/frontend/Vaimo/demo/en_US/css/source/_reset.less: [L7:C4] Error evaluating function `unit`: the first argument to unit must be a number. Have you forgotten parenthesis? Warning: Error compiling pub/static/frontend/Vaimo/demo/en_US/css/styles-m.less Use --force to continue. Aborted due to warnings. ``` ### Related Pull Requests - https://github.com/magento/magento2/pull/31618 - https://github.com/magento/magento2/commit/203f415cd5f314401a335991bd97919e3baa9dc3 ### Manual testing scenarios (*) 1. setup a new theme 2. prepare Grunt files 3. run npm install 4. run `grunt clean:theme && exec:theme && less:theme` 5. see that sourcemaps not generated even if you disable static sign, cache, browser cache, etc. 6. restore the package version to `1.4.1` from `~2.1.0` 7. run `npm i` 8. repeat the 4th step 9. see sourcemaps in the browser's devtools. ### Contribution checklist (*) - [ ] Pull request has a meaningful description of its purpose - [ ] All commits are accompanied by meaningful commit messages - [ ] All new or changed code is covered with unit/integration tests (if applicable) - [ ] README.md files for modified modules are updated and included in the pull request if any [README.md predefined sections](https://github.com/magento/devdocs/wiki/Magento-module-README.md) require an update - [ ] All automated tests passed successfully (all builds are green)

issue.title: [Cloud] Special characters cannot be used in name fields

labels.name: Reproduced on 2.4.x
labels.description: The issue has been reproduced on latest 2.4-develop branch

labels.name: Severity: S3
labels.description: Affects non-critical data or functionality and does not force users to employ a workaround.

issue.body:
*To resolve this, we need to create a patch to modify this line: <https://github.com/magento/magento2/blame/2.4-develop/app/code/Magento/Customer/Controller/Adminhtml/Index/Validate.php#L146-L146C54>*

*The check needs to be set to false since we are on the admin side:*
*`phpCopy code$customerForm->setInvisibleIgnored(false);`*


### Steps to reproduce

*1. Go to Customers > all customer*
*2. Edit or add customer* 
*3. When you fill customers name add special characters & and try to save.*

*You will get following error:* 
*First Name is not valid!*
### Actual results

*When you try to save customer name with special characters &  you get the following error:* 

*First Name is not valid!*
### Expected results

*According to customer they should be able to save customer name with special characters &*

*Example: Mccarty & Smith*

comment.body: Internal team is working on this.

issue.title: Extend Checkout XML to allow shipping method additional templates and UiComponents
issue.body: ### Description When a payment method is added on the checkout page, it renders its children automatically: - additional forms - xtra buttons and so on However, for the shipping methods, there is no such option and in my personal opinion, that feature is missing from the platform. This can be achieved by adding this to `shipping-method-item.html` template: ``` ``` By having this in knockout.JS tempate, you can add a uiComponent by XML like this: ``` Custom_Shipping/js/view/checkout/shipping pocztapolska pocztapolska ``` FOr reference: this is how payment methods do it: ``` uiComponent ``` ### Expected behavior - allow developers to easy extend shipping options with UiComponents ### Benefits - no need for custom JS appending DOM - automatic initialization of UiComponents - faster shipping module development that have extra features, like this one: ![image](https://github.com/magento/magento2/assets/4256191/37b041aa-1a15-4ee7-9c99-273254967766) - easy to extend / modify custom features by using Layout XML ### Additional information This can be implemented just by simple `shipping-method-item.html` template modification. Would require some information for developers and some samples how easy it is to create UiComponents for shipping methods. ### Release note _No response_

issue.title: Extend Checkout XML to allow shipping method additional templates and UiComponents
issue.body: ### Description When a payment method is added on the checkout page, it renders its children automatically: - additional forms - xtra buttons and so on However, for the shipping methods, there is no such option and in my personal opinion, that feature is missing from the platform. This can be achieved by adding this to `shipping-method-item.html` template: ``` ``` By having this in knockout.JS tempate, you can add a uiComponent by XML like this: ``` Custom_Shipping/js/view/checkout/shipping pocztapolska pocztapolska ``` FOr reference: this is how payment methods do it: ``` uiComponent ``` ### Expected behavior - allow developers to easy extend shipping options with UiComponents ### Benefits - no need for custom JS appending DOM - automatic initialization of UiComponents - faster shipping module development that have extra features, like this one: ![image](https://github.com/magento/magento2/assets/4256191/37b041aa-1a15-4ee7-9c99-273254967766) - easy to extend / modify custom features by using Layout XML ### Additional information This can be implemented just by simple `shipping-method-item.html` template modification. Would require some information for developers and some samples how easy it is to create UiComponents for shipping methods. ### Release note _No response_

comment.body:
Hi, @engcom-Bravo 

**Problem Location (in the vendor directory):**

`vendor/magento/module-inventory-admin-ui/view/adminhtml/ui_component/inventory_source_listing.xml`

**Solution:**

You need to override this file in your local module. Instead of directly modifying the core Magento files, always try to override them in your local module to ensure future compatibility and easier upgrades.

**Override Path:**

`app/code/[Your_Company]/[Your_Module]/view/adminhtml/ui_component/inventory_source_listing.xml`

(Note: Replace [Your_Company] and [Your_Module] with your actual company and module names.)

**File Content:**
Your overridden XML should look like this:

```
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<!--
/**
 * Copyright © Magento, Inc. All rights reserved.
 * See COPYING.txt for license details.
 */
-->
<listing xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="urn:magento:module:Magento_Ui:etc/ui_configuration.xsd">
    <dataSource name="inventory_source_listing_data_source" component="Magento_Ui/js/grid/provider">
        <settings>
            <storageConfig>
                <param name="requestConfig" xsi:type="array">
                    <param name="method" xsi:type="string">POST</param>
                </param>
            </storageConfig>
        </settings>
    </dataSource>
</listing>
```
By following these steps, you should be able to successfully override the method and change the request type from GET to POST. Remember, always try to avoid editing the core files directly. Instead, make use of Magento's override system.

issue.title: Remove unnecessary cache manipulation during setup

labels.name: partners-contribution
labels.description: Pull Request is created by Magento Partner

labels.name: Priority: P2
labels.description: A defect with this priority could have functionality issues which are not to expectations.

issue.body:
### Description

When running `bin/magento setup:db-data:upgrade` (or `bin/magento setup:upgrade`), Magento turns off some caches, then re-enables the same. This causes Magento to write out its configuration to disk, but this step seems unnecessary and is causing some issues with downstream modules which observe this event (write deployment configuration to disk) because it is not necessary at this step. Relevant caches are already cleared later on in the process, so turning them off and then back on again seems redundant.

I can't work out why this was added. The best I can find is the initial commit (https://github.com/magento/magento2/commit/96a2e17754c78e3939fcbe14f7729d7ded52e544), which says "MC-30236: Upgrade from 2.3.x CE with SD to 2.3.x EE AreaCode Exception". `MC-30263` seems like a reference to a ticket, but I don't have any visibility on this. I don't see any tests associated with this commit to demonstrate the bug it claims to resolve. The description of the supposed bug ("AreaCode Exception") suggests that this action (disable/enable caches) is not the correct resolution anyway. This pull request effectively removes all changes related to that ticket from this repository.

For my reference later, the specific case which we were investigating (which lead me back to this) was https://gitlab.hyva.io/hyva-themes/magento2-theme-module/-/blob/main/src/Plugin/HyvaModulesConfig/UpdateOnModuleStatusChange.php?ref_type=heads#L40 being called during during deployment, which over-wrote the file we stored in version control.

### Manual testing scenarios
1. Environment file gets regenerated as expected.
   1. Add a code comment to `app/etc/env.php`
   1. Run `bin/magento cache:disable layout && bin/magento cache:enable`
   1. Review the content of `app/etc/env.php` to see that the file has been regenerated.
1. Environment file does *not* get regenerated during `setup` commands
   1. Add a code comment to `app/etc/env.php`
   1. Run `bin/magento setup:db-data:upgrade`
   1. Review the content of `app/etc/env.php` to see that the file has *not* been modified.
   1. Run `bin/magento setup:upgrade`
   1. Review the content of `app/etc/env.php` to see that the file has *not* been modified.

### Questions or comments
I am happy to learn more about _why_ this code was initially added. It may be that the bug this was intended to fix no longer exists, or that there is a better way to fix that bug if it still remains.

### Contribution checklist
 - [x] Pull request has a meaningful description of its purpose
 - [x] All commits are accompanied by meaningful commit messages
 - [x] All new or changed code is covered with unit/integration tests (if applicable)
 - [x] README.md files for modified modules are updated and included in the pull request if any [README.md predefined sections](https://github.com/magento/devdocs/wiki/Magento-module-README.md) require an update
 - [x] All automated tests passed successfully (all builds are green)


### Resolved issues:
1. [x] resolves magento/magento2#38124: Remove unnecessary cache manipulation during setup

issue.title: Mitigate performance issue in #36667 during price indexing

labels.name: Priority: P2
labels.description: A defect with this priority could have functionality issues which are not to expectations.

issue.body:
<!---
    Thank you for contributing to Magento.
    To help us process this pull request we recommend that you add the following information:
     - Summary of the pull request,
     - Issue(s) related to the changes made,
     - Manual testing scenarios
    Fields marked with (*) are required. Please don't remove the template.
-->

<!--- Please provide a general summary of the Pull Request in the Title above -->

### Description (*)
<!---
    Please provide a description of the changes proposed in the pull request.
    Letting us know what has changed and why it needed changing will help us validate this pull request.
-->
This is the first part of solving partially the issue #36667 tackling the performance issue of the queries coming from related / upsell and cross-sell blocks.

As described in #36667 the related / upsell and cross-sell blocks run a non optimized query breaking magento in MariaDB versions 10.4-10.6 because these long running queries prevent the indexer from renaming the tables creating a long running exclusive lock on the tables instead. 

https://github.com/magento/magento2/issues/36667#issuecomment-1725549906

### Related Pull Requests


### Fixed Issues (if relevant)
<!---
    If relevant, please provide a list of fixed issues in the format magento/magento2#<issue_number>.
    There could be 1 or more issues linked here and it will help us find some more information about the reasoning behind this change.
-->
1. Fixes magento/magento2#36667

### Manual testing scenarios (*)
<!---
    Please provide a set of unambiguous steps to test the proposed code change.
    Giving us manual testing scenarios will help with the processing and validation process.
-->
1. It's not so simple to test this, you need to actually replicate the situation but you can visually check that it has an effect on the queries coming from the blocks because intially they cause a double join. With this PR the double join is removed essentially mitigating the issue. 

### Questions or comments
<!---
	If relevant, here you can ask questions or provide comments on your pull request for the reviewer
	For example if you need assistance with writing tests or would like some feedback on one of your development ideas
-->



### Contribution checklist (*)

 - [ ] README.md files for modified modules are updated and included in the pull request if any [README.md predefined sections](https://github.com/magento/devdocs/wiki/Magento-module-README.md) require an update
 - [ ] All automated tests passed successfully (all builds are green)

comment.body:
Thanks for the kind words. I had been struggling for months with this and you were one of the few people who tried to help. 
I just hope this will get merged to save a lot of headaches and the magento team will realistically think about revamping the indexers. Indexing has and will always be a pain for all shop owners with a lot of bugs, but dropping the whole website down just because a long select is running on the tables is something I would have never imagined. It's unrealistic to think that there are never going to be long running queries.

pull_request.title: addProductsToCart mutation reports proper errors in user_errors request in GraphQL
pull_request.body: ### Description (*) As per this issue, the condition for failed sku, we need to show the error in user_errors field, but in the code, it was pushed the cart error along with the failed user input, so the correct sku also got an error. ### Related Pull Requests 1. Fixes for #37908 ### Fixed Issues (if relevant) 1. Fixes magento/magento2#37908 ### Manual testing scenarios (*) 1. Create a product "PRODUCT-1" with inventory of 190 2. Create a product "PRODUCT-2" with inventory of 123 (make sure indexers etc. have ran) 3. Create an empty cart: 4. Add a product with for quantity of 123 to the cart. 5. Run this mutation again, you will see an error on user_errors, this is correct. 6. Change the quantity of PRODUCT-2 to 50 in the backend 7. Add the first product to the cart with quantity of 1 We have added a PRODUCT-2 with more than qty 123. Here We are getting errors it is expected. user error will come only when the user is trying to add insufficient qty product. ### Questions or comments ### Contribution checklist (*) - [x] Pull request has a meaningful description of its purpose - [x] All commits are accompanied by meaningful commit messages - [ ] All new or changed code is covered with unit/integration tests (if applicable) - [ ] README.md files for modified modules are updated and included in the pull request if any [README.md predefined sections](https://github.com/magento/devdocs/wiki/Magento-module-README.md) require an update - [ ] All automated tests passed successfully (all builds are green)

issue.title: [Code Cleanup]Removed unused Type configuration
issue.body:
### Description (*)
_Code Cleanup:_
Removed Type configuration for `Magento\Translation\Model\Js` in [app/code/Magento/Translation/etc/di.xml](https://github.com/magento/magento2/blob/bc1c7bac0b2d5b25491f34b17c055149780435fc/app/code/Magento/Translation/etc/di.xml#L68) since file `Magento\Translation\Model\Js` does not exist.

### Related Pull Requests
<!-- related pull request placeholder -->

### Fixed Issues (if relevant)
1. Fixes magento/magento2#38030

### Manual testing scenarios (*)
1. Re-deploy to test.

### Questions or comments
As I understand, `Magento\Translation\Model\Js\DataProvider` is used for generating `js-tranlation.json`.
It seems that the Translation module was designed to have multiple `DataProvider`s to generate `js-tranlation.json` in its early development stage.

### Contribution checklist (*)
 - [x] Pull request has a meaningful description of its purpose
 - [x] All commits are accompanied by meaningful commit messages

 - [x] README.md files for modified modules are updated and included in the pull request if any [README.md predefined sections](https://github.com/magento/devdocs/wiki/Magento-module-README.md) require an update

It looks like that class got removed back in 2015 in: https://github.com/magento/magento2/commit/7522b39e923#diff-4c9dae24a41ae1208514d6e0c3cfce7912c559399c746fe40514c274162ea11e

And they probably forgot to remove it as well from the `di.xml` file, so I think you've got a point @wubinworks that this declaration isn't needed and can be removed.
